headline: From the Hairy Who to Solo Success
abstract: Gladys Nilsson, a bold watercolorist rooted in Chicago’s surrealist ’60s art group, on finally finding solo success.
lead_paragraph: In 1966, Gladys Nilsson and five other young artists organized an exhibition of their work in Chicago’s Hyde Park Art Center, and overnight became the talk of the town. The group called themselves the Hairy Who.
